properties.name: Kind
properties.help: The kind of the bot.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The resource name of the bot.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Appid
properties.help: The Microsoft account ID (MSA ID) to be used with the bot.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: The Microsoft account (MSA) password for the bot.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: The description of the bot.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.help: The display name of the bot. If not specified, defaults to the name of the bot.

properties.name: Endpoint
properties.help: The messaging endpoint of the bot.

properties.name: Sku
properties.help: The Sku of the bot.

properties.name: InsightsLocation
properties.help: The location for the app insights to be used with the bot.

properties.name: Lang
properties.help: The language to be used to create the bot.

properties.name: Storage
properties.help: Storage account name to be used with the bot. If not provided, a new account will be created.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The Microsoft Bot Builder SDK version to be used to create the bot.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.
